metadata.title: CVE-2009-3604 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The Splash::drawImage function in Splash.cc in Xpdf 2.x and 3.x before3.02pl4, and Poppler 0.x, as used in GPdf and kdegraphics KPDF, does notproperly allocate memory, which allows remote attackers to cause a denialof service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via acrafted PDF document that triggers a NULL pointer dereference or aheap-based buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-3604` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xpdf - 3.02-2
No subscription required

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.12.2-2.1ubuntu1
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.12.2-2.1ubuntu1
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.12.2-2.1ubuntu1
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.12.2-2.1ubuntu1
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.12.2-2.1ubuntu1
libpoppler52 - 0.12.2-2.1ubuntu1
poppler-utils - 0.12.2-2.1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xpdf package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.02-2').
poppler package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.12.2-2.1ubuntu1').
ipe package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
